row.title: Funded Research
row.field_page_description: The Office of Cancer Nanotechnology Research at NCI develops and implements many programs centered around Nanotechnology. Find out more here about these programs.

row.title: Innovative Research in Cancer Nanotechnology (IRCNs)
row.field_page_description: IRCNs engage in directed, product-focused research that aims to translate cutting-edge science and technology into the next generation of diagnostic and therapeutic tools.
row.field_feature_card_description: IRCN's enable multidisciplinary, fundamental research in cancer biology and/or oncology through the use of nanotechnology
row.field_list_description: IRCN's enable multidisciplinary, fundamental research in cancer biology and/or oncology through the use of nanotechnology

row.title: Cancer and Nanotechnology
row.field_page_description: Cancer and nanotechnology offers a new approach to tackle and ancient disease. Discover here how and why nanotechnology will benefit clinical cancer care
row.field_list_description: Cancer is a collection of disease types that have elluded detection and treatment for many millenia of human history. Nanotechnology is the application of nanoscale matierals as well as their manipulation at that scale and is a product of modern science. Nanotechnology for cancer offers a myriad of potential solotions for contemporary oncology.

row.title: Cancer Nanotechnology Plan
row.field_page_description: The Cancer Nanotechnology Plan serves as a strategic document to the NCI Alliance for Nanotechnology in Cancer as well as a guiding document to the cancer nanotechnology and oncology fields, as a whole.
row.field_feature_card_description: The Cancer Nanotechnology Plan serves as a strategic document to the NCI Alliance for Nanotechnology in Cancer as well as a guiding document to the cancer nanotechnology and oncology fields, as a whole.
row.field_list_description: The Cancer Nanotechnology Plan serves as a strategic document to the NCI Alliance for Nanotechnology in Cancer as well as a guiding document to the cancer nanotechnology and oncology fields, as a whole.

row.title: Centers of Cancer Nanotechnology Excellence (CCNEs)
row.field_page_description: CCNE teams are focused on integrated technology solutions and the aggressive development of these solutions from pre-clinical to clinical application.
row.field_feature_card_description: The multi-disciplinary CCNE teams are the main venue for the discovery and tool development toward the application of nanotechnology to clinical oncology.
row.field_list_description: The multi-disciplinary CCNE teams are the main venue for the discovery and tool development toward the application of nanotechnology to clinical oncology. Teams are focused on integrated technology solutions and the aggressive development of these solutions from pre-clinical to clinical application.

row.title: NSDB Grants and Training
row.field_page_description: The NCI offers many funding opportunities for next generation technologies for cancer, including nanotechnology. Find out about recent opportunities for research and training here.
row.field_feature_card_description: The NCI has many opportunities to fund research and training. Specific ones pertaining to the Alliance and other relavent technology focused opportunities are listed here.
row.field_list_description: The NCI has many opportunities to fund research and training. Specific ones pertaining to the Alliance and other relavent technology focused opportunities are listed here.
row.intro:
Funding opportunities currently available from the NCI Nanodelivery Systems and Devices Branch for the NCI Alliance for Nanotechnology in Cancer (link for downloadable Factsheet) are accessible from Apply to Alliance and other opportunities are accessible from Research Funding below.

Similarly, funding for specific research or training opportunities within the field of cancer nanotechnology or fields that contain much cross-sectional overlap to cancer nanotechnology may be accessed from either Related NCI Funding and Initiatives or Training Grants below. These opportunities are from across the NIH and are offered here as a resource to the research community. Also, you may visit the NIH Guide for Grants and Contracts for the latest publication of all NIH funding opportunities and notices.

row.title: News and Events
row.field_page_description: The latest news from the Nanodelivery Systems and Devices Branch and the Alliance, as well as upcoming and past events attended by the Nanodelivery Systems and Devices Branchstaff, and relevant upcoming scientific meetings.
row.field_feature_card_description: The latest news from the Nanodelivery Systems and Devices Branch and the Alliance, as well as upcoming and past events attended by the Nanodelivery Systems and Devices Branchstaff, and relevant upcoming scientific meetings.
row.field_list_description: The latest news from the Nanodelivery Systems and Devices Branch and the Alliance, as well as upcoming and past events attended by the Office of Cancer Nanotechnology Research staff, and relevant upcoming scientific meetings.
row.field_browser_title: News and Events - Nanodelivery Systems and Devices Branch

row.title: NCI Alliance for Nanotechnology in Cancer
row.field_short_title: NCI Alliance for Nanotechnology in Cancer
row.field_page_description: The NCI Alliance for Nanotechnology in Cancer funds the Cancer Nanotechnology Training Centers collectively with the NCI Cancer Training Center. Find out about the funded Centers, to date, that train our next generation of scientists in the field of Canc
row.field_feature_card_description: Launched in 2004, the NCI Alliance for Nanotechnology in Cancer program is a comprehensive, structured effort, encompassing the public and private sectors, to converge multidisciplinary research in cancer nanotechnology.
row.field_list_description: Launched in 2004, the NCI Alliance for Nanotechnology in Cancer program is a comprehensive, structured effort, encompassing the public and private sector to converge multidisciplinary research in nanotechnology to advance the fight against cancer.
row.field_browser_title: NCI Alliance for Nanotechnology in Cancer
row.field_card_title: NCI Alliance for Nanotechnology in Cancer

row.title: Cancer Nanotechnology Training Centers (CNTCs)
row.field_page_description: NCI offers Cancer Nanotechnology Training Centers to train the next generation of multidisciplinary scientists and clinicians.
row.field_feature_card_description: CNTCs are designed to establish innovative research education programs supporting the development of a multi-disciplinary nanotechnology workforce capable of pursuing cancer research.
row.field_list_description: CNTCs are designed to establish innovative research education programs supporting the development of a multi-disciplinary nanotechnology workforce capable of pursuing cancer research.
